metadata.title: CVE-2022-1049 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Pacemaker configuration tool (pcs). The pcs daemon was allowing expired accounts, and accounts with expired passwords to login when using PAM authentication. Therefore, unprivileged expired accounts that have been denied access could still login.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pcs - 0.11.3-1ubuntu1
pcs-snmp - 0.11.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcs package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.11.3-1ubuntu1').
